result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickalaus K Essers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Court orders the defendant re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel - TO BE DETERMINED.  Court orders the money on file be applied first to the re-payment of the attorney fees and then to the court costs.  On May 17, 2016 Court orders the defendant to re-pay the costs for Court Appointed Attorney Fees - $2,303.00.

Atty Fees and court costs totalling $2821.00 - PAID IN FULL.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:41 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jim Peebles.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea NO CONTEST to 2015CF34 and parties are free to argue and 2014CF68 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Peebles concurs.  Defendant concurs.  State moves to dismiss without prejudice.  Court grants dismissal without prejudice.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Peebles.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Court appointed attorney fees.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the money on file be applied first to the court appointed attorney fees and any balance applied to the court costs. 

Court adjourned at 9:51 a.m.

9:16 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jim Peebles.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Peebles, more discussions have been held, no resolution at this time.  Court will set for Motion Hearing on August 4, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:17 a.m.

1:46 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty James Peebles.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Peebles - requests another status to see if resolution can be reached.  Court makes statement regarding motions filed.  Court sets for status hearing on June 23, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Court orders processing on 2015CF34.

Court adjourned at 1:47 p.m.

10:14 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jim Peebles.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Peebles - will waive the prelim on 2015CF34.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Peebles and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Peebles enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set both cases for Status Hearing on May 19, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.
and Order (Monies are being collected on 2014CF68)

10:39 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jim Peebles.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Peebles will accept the appointment on this case.  Court appoints Atty Peebles on this case 2015CF34.  Defendant to continue with payments.  Atty Peebles confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  2014CF68 - Atty Peebles requests both matters be set for Status Hearing in 30-60 days.  Court will set both cases for Status Hearing in approx 30 days - April 7, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:42 a.m.
